messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Red heads - was Is It Normal?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Me too.  Actually, a local company tried to bring it back a few years ago. They were also the only company selling milk in glass bottles.  They had to give
messages.messageBody:
> <<and yeah, I'm that old. Back in the good ole' days when milk was placed
> in little boxes outside the house, and you'd place your wants in a little
> note inside one of the bottles>>
>
>
> Oh My God!!! I remember those days too! Not sure I want to, that dates me!

Me too. Actually, a local company tried to bring it back a few years ago.
They were also the only company selling milk in glass bottles. They had to
give it up when the company making the bottles stopped making them.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Red heads - was Is It Normal?
messages.messageBody:
>From: "mary krzyzanowski" <meembeam@...>

<<My dh remembers milk vending machines on street corners of Buffalo, NY.
I'd love it if milk was delivered to my door daily, it would save me the
late night/early morning trips just to get milk.>>


You and me both!! I'm at Farm Store so much I should just get a job there!!!

Mary B

messages.msgSnippet: My dh remembers milk vending machines on street corners of Buffalo, NY.  I d love it if milk was delivered to my door daily, it would save me the late
messages.messageBody:
My dh remembers milk vending machines on street corners of Buffalo, NY. I'd
love it if milk was delivered to my door daily, it would save me the late
night/early morning trips just to get milk.
Mary-NY

Shyrley
